snippet: At least 13 people were killed and over 100 injured in a double bombing at a police station in Russia’s tumultuous North Caucasus region late Thursday night.
abstract: At least 13 people are killed and more than 100 injured after double bombing at a police station in Russia's tumultuous North Caucasus region; attack is stark reminder of challenges facing Vladimir V Putin in the region as he prepares to take over presidency. Photo (M)1
lead_paragraph: MOSCOW -- At least 13 people were killed and more than 100 were wounded in a double bombing at a police station in Russia's tumultuous North Caucasus region late Thursday night, officials said, a stark reminder of the challenges facing Vladimir V. Putin in the region as he prepares to take over the presidency next week. Investigators said Friday that a suicide bomber set off at least one of the explosive devices at the police station in Dagestan, a mostly Muslim region that neighbors Chechnya.

headline.main: Police Station Hit by Blasts In Dagestan
